[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The System Administration Module (SAM) defines requirements for managing configurations, accounts, and monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SAM enables real-time system administration across library branches, supporting configuration, logging, and access control.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SAM integrates with library databases and APIs for cataloging and circulation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SAM provides web-based and desktop interfaces for administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SAM supports library hardware, including barcode scanners and servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SAM interacts with databases and APIs for synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SAM ensures secure communication via SSL and SFTP.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SAM is optimized for handling high-volume transactions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SAM supports centralized and distributed environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SAM supports vendor APIs and MARC21 metadata exchange.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SAM enables system configuration, monitoring, user access management, and task scheduling.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SAM is designed for administrators managing library operations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SAM requires integration with library systems.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SAM assumes connectivity to cataloging modules and standardized API endpoints.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: MARC21:  Standard for encoding library metadata.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with library databases for real-time synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide secure API access for third-party integration.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall monitor server performance in real time.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enable automated backups and log retention.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a role-based dashboard.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall include accessibility features.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process queries within 2 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 500 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store all records in a relational database.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall ensure transactional integrity.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use a relational database back-end.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall generate compliant HTML.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with MARC21 metadata standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions, including user access and changes.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall scale to accommodate higher transaction volumes.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and user testing to validate security, functionality, and performance.
[SEC] 5. References: MARC21 standards, API documentation, and security compliance guidelines.
